page.title: 06C M School History
page.content: In 1716 George Ley left property in his will to endow a free school. The building used was an old market house near the church. In 1875 the school was reorganised into separate Boys and Girls schools. In 1906, because of overcrowding, further building work was needed and the Infants were taught in the Baptist school room. It was not until 1923 that all the children were accomodated in the same building. In 1926 the new Senior School was built at the Seaside end of the village. In 1969 the Senior School children were transferred to the new Comprehensive School in Ilfracombe and in early 1971,after building alterations, 196 Primary School children moved in. By a strange coincidence there were also 196 children at the school in July 1985.
